comments.commentBody: May my call that the game is over come back to bite me. Nothing would make me happier than to see a Texas victory, but, it might be a little too late. You never know. Stranger things have happened.

Thanks for explaining the THREE answer, Jim. Also, your description of the solving process is spot on, though it does not include a sixth step which seems to be necessary for me. That is a break, sometimes just a few minutes (like checking the score of tonight's game) and sometimes overnight. Then you pick up the puzzle again and bingo, empty squares seem to fill themselves in.

Wonderful puzzle, thank you PB.
wondering why Alabama felt they had to run up the score!!

Saban has no class. Up 10, 1st and goal, with under a minute to go? Have your QB take a knee, don't run up the score.

What a jerk.
If Koppel is hired, I would actually start tuning in again to the Sunday morning talking heads.   The loss of of Tim Russert just killed Sunday morning.

Remember the good old days:
39 week seasons,
only 3 commercial brakes per half hour.
Whatever happened to the good old days?
We miss Jay at the 11:35 time-slot. We tried Conan's show but find it unfunny and less than interesting.
Do they still show these late night shows on network TV?  Who knew?

I’m not sure that Jeff Zucker can be totally blamed for this. NBC has a history of “killing a good thing” while shooting themselves in the foot.

(I’m not even going to mention their news division here, “little sister MSNBC.”)

NBC had the most original comedy show on American TV with Saturday Night Live. However, through arrogance and trying to save a buck, they allowed the creator, writer, and producer: Lorne Michaels to leave the show. SNL fell into the crapper and was almost canceled. It wasn’t until NBC swallowed their pride and took Michaels back, that the show took off again.

NBC owned Thursday nights with a comedy line up that no one could beat. “The Cosby Show”, “Family Ties”, “Cheers”, and “Night Court.” (Followed by a 10 pm drama.) However, owning Thursday night was not good enough for NBC and they pulled “Family Ties” and “Night Court” from that line up, and switched them to another night. Both of those comedies lost some of their viewers and the replacement shows for Thursday: “A different World” and “Wings” caused some people to change the channel.

The “Tonight Show” had virtually no competition until NBC picked Leno to replace Johnny Carson, which caused Letterman to become their rival on CBS. Leno never achieved the high ratings that Carson enjoyed because Letterman and Leno split that audience.

So I am not surprised to hear this.

The old motto: “If it works, don’t fix it.”

(That doesn’t apply to NBC.)

Old habits die hard.  Early evening, I must have thought of tuning in to Leno dozens of times, but actually remembered to do so at 10:00 some half dozen times!  By the time I'd remember, it was too late, and I was never into Conan's comedy anyway.  Multiply my story by several million habituated curmudgeons, and that's how many viewers Jay loses.  So one question remains:  WHY DIDN'T THOSE CLOWNS IN MANAGEMENT ANTICIPATE ALL THIS????
But Leno is not funny!! AHH!!

I think it is disingenuous of Jay Leno to say, "It's not my fault. I was happy where I was." As I remember it, he retired! Conan moved into Jay's chair, as arranged, and Jay was supposed to enjoy his cars and some golf and the life of a very wealthy man. The problem arose when Jay decided that he didn't want to retire after all. NBC came up with the nightly ten o'clock show, and everyone used to watching their favorite shows at their normal times became baffled and then changed the channel. " Law and Order" had been on Wednesday night at ten o'clock forever; now it's Jay Leno? Come on!
Of course Leno wanted to stay. The last couple of months that he was on the air, he was treated to special guests and a host of memories of his years on the Tonight Show. For those of us who remember, he was the "young guy" who took over when Johnny Carson retired. Johnny had the right idea. When it was time to say good bye, he did so, and left. He understood the point of the special parties and tributes, and handled them all with the grace and style that one would expect.
Leno's attempt at another act always seemed ill-advised. As my mother always said, "you leave the party a little early, and once you leave, don't go back!"
is jay leno becoming the face of NBC? doesn't make sense. he's had his day, let Conan take over for REAL.

While this situation is certainly a conundrum for NBC, I feel it is only a part of what has gone
wrong with the once-proud Peacock network. There is currently not one program that I watch
on NBC, not one. For drama, there is so much more offered on cable (i.e. "Mad Men", "Damages'"
and "Breaking Bad") and ABC has me hooked on Wednesdays with its great comedy lineup.
I cannot wait for "24" and "Lost" to come back on the air. See? Not one NBC show among
them. To give Leno the 10:00 slot and then to let him dictate that nothing too downbeat should
be broadcast before his show was to give him far too much authority. What was the last really
good drama that NBC developed? "Southland"--and they cancelled it. NBC should get some
new blood, Conan should go back to 12:30 (older people like my father cannot stand him), and
Jay should content himself with performing in Las Vegas. Bring in someone totally new for
11:30. What have they got to lose, now?
I would suggest Casa Vicente for a unique evening. We were invited by close friends and had an incredible time: great food, entertainment, and a warm, fun ambiance.

A weird thing happened to Conan when he moved into Leno's slot. All of a sudden he had to (or NBC made him) try to appeal to the Baby Boomers who always fell asleep before he used to come on the air at 12:35.

Conan was always funnier than Leno. But, flamoyant witty humor is his thing. Not Leno's topical irony. Can you imagine Craig Ferguson from CBS doing what he does in Leno's time slot? NBC wouldn't allow it, and Ferguson, in trying to be Leno, would fail, just like Conan.

Conan should just do his normal, outrageous show, like he always did, without trying to appeal to the Generation "I'll Never Retire". Then, just then, he might succeed.

I suppose that those who say Leno is funnier than Conan have been taking their Ambien before 12:35 for years and never watched Conan's old show. Having said that, if my only impression of O'Brien were post-Leno, then I'd have to agree that in the Tonight Show time slot, Leno's show was funnier.

I think both Obrien and Leno are funny, but Fallon is not funny at all.  In my opinion people like Fallon because he's cute.  I would love Conan to move his show from 11 to 12, and Leno from 12 to 12:30.  Otherwise NBC plan is OK.
The Jimmy Fallon show is refreshing. Sounds like NBC is about to make their next big mistake.
I think Jimmy Fallon is the best of the three and should stay where he is.  Conan can take the late late spot or give Jimmy the 11:30 slot.

This whole thing reminds us of the new recipe for Coke, then they had to come back with the "Classic Coke". What a disaster that was!
NBC gave him a new lousy spot when he was the funniest late night host. How can you run Conan against Letterman? When you get cheap, it always cost you more on the long run. JMO.

So Leno gets only a half hour? That puts him on a par with NBC Nightly News for airtime.

The next thing I'll hear is that Leno's replacing Nightly's Brian Williams! Only joking. NBC Nightly News, Friday Night Lights and the Office are the only NBC shows I watch regularly. And The Office is getting long in the tooth.

I think it will be the best thing to put Jay Leno back to his orignial late night time. I was a regular with his show in CA. He is just not the same on prime time, and I don't care for the new informal format with him and the two chairs. It is not working for me. I like him the way he was on the Late Show! Besides in the 10:00 pm slot he seems rushed and like its a low budget show. Sorry, but that's my take on it.

No No No NO!

Jimmy Fallon is the best thing since Johnny Carson but we are already sleep deprived when he starts at 12:37. Don't throw him under the bus! Conan is a flop on the tonight show. He is not funny enough to watch consistently.

Most people with day jobs (especially on the east coast) don't stay up that late.  Isn't it the people that actually work that advertisers are after?  10:00 works for me, but I guess I am in the minority.

If it is a half hour for Leno it is basically the monologue in the nightclub format from the Tonight Show.  I say give Leno 30 minutes, O'brien and Fallon 15 minutes and forget about the guests that only come on to plug their latest movie or t.v. show.  The guests on these shows have been boring ever since John Lennon appeared on the Dick Cavett show.  Bring back interesting guests, please!
